website_summaries.verdict: Lightweight, ergonomic keyboard/mouse combo. Wave design has a natural feel and shape for the hands.
pros: Many programmable buttons and added functions
Wrist rest and kickstand to elevate
cons: It makes a noticeable clicking sound when you type, and it's not Bluetooth

customer_reviews.title: HEY Logitech! READ THIS.
customer_reviews.text: I generally only buy Logitech when I get third-party stuff because I trust the quality, and this keyboard is really good EXCEPT for one shocking problem. The keyboard sags in the center when resting your palms and typing. It makes this ANNOYING creaking sound that will drive you crazy. The good news is that I fixed it by applying some felt “feet” under the center where is sags (see pic). Very easy, but WTF!!! Come on Logitech, are you guys sleeping at your work stations?!
customer_reviews.author: Jeff S

customer_reviews.title: Had it for years, now time for upgrade
customer_reviews.text: I've used this keyboard for nearly 6 years. It has served me well. There are a lot of pros with this as well as cons. The pros are the comfortability, the big buttons, the raised keyboard support, the wrist support, the battery life is pretty good as well. The problems, the letters scratch off pretty easily. If I didn't know where the "A" "S" and the "T" buttons were I would be lost. The keyboard doesn't light up either.. This isn't Logitech's fault.. It's just something I want. Overall, this is a pretty solid keyboard. It's served me well. It's not a bad buy.. I would like to see what Logitech's future offering is.
customer_reviews.author: DaveSincere

customer_reviews.title: wired keyboard is best and the Logitech M510
customer_reviews.text: This model has very long lag keyboard delay more than I think it should have even though it comes with the M510 mouse. I timed the delay up to 7 seconds.... I have a M510 for my lappy and never an issue. Sorry Logitech, you guys are all aware of these failure that this RF design issue is problematic across the your wireless product line. I have now MK710 combo. I think it goes back. Not as much lag on keyboard but mouse lag makes up for it. Yup, wired keyboard is best and the Logitech M510. Had my current lappy M510 since 2007 !! Think company, think... dont react...
customer_reviews.author: Mario

customer_reviews.title: A comfortable efficient keyboard, I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great key board, I have been swearing buy it for six years now and this particular model has many followers in my office now. It is great to type on especially if you have a tendency for long days of keyboarding. It is a comfortable efficient keyboard. I highly recomend it.
customer_reviews.author: Crystal

customer_reviews.title: Have used one for years.
customer_reviews.text: Have used this model keyboard for many years. Actually, the letters had worn off many of the keys had worn off. I know how to type but it is still nice to have the letter/numbers on the keys. Also, some of the keys were physically sticking which makes it difficult to type efficiently. This model keyboard is ergonomically easy to use. Tried a different model for a while but it was not ergonomic and more difficult to type efficiently. It didn't long so replaced it with my old standby model. would highly recommend this keyboard/ mouse combo.
customer_reviews.author: MagicBob

customer_reviews.title: Love It!
customer_reviews.text: I love this wireless keyboard and mouse. It is ergonomically styled and does help with my wrists after hours of typing. It does not take long to get used to, and the buttons are clearly labeled. All that is needed is a gentle push. The wireless factor is absolutely fantastic!!! I can be as mobile as I wish in my office. the mouse moves easily and quickly. Very much worth the price. I use it for computer work like spreadsheets and not for gaming. However, I can image that it is good for that as well. I have not used the sleep mode yet.
customer_reviews.author: Love2Read

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: I've had this same keyboard for 5+ years, bought a second for a second system. The keyboard layout is excellent, I really prefer the slightly rounded design (rather than straight lines of keys). The wrist support is plenty for regular use, and has held up well. I'm on the computer for work all the time, mine is still in excellent shape. The mouse has held up well. There are several customizable buttons on the keyboard and mouse. The logitech mapper is easy and intuitive to use. I highly recommend this setup!
customer_reviews.author: Travis

customer_reviews.title: Not the right keyboard for me - update
customer_reviews.text: First off this thing is huge, takes up a lot of real estate on the desk. I don't particularly like the wave design either. I find my fingers missing the keys because they aren't where the should be (at least not like a regular keyboard.) Also the keys feel smaller. I settled on this because other options were not available at the time, and I'll end up keeping it because I rarely return things. I do like the mouse though. UPDATE: OK the keyboard doesn't bug me so much anymore, but I do still prefer a standard keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Nice large keyboard with several cool features
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard and mouse combo are very easy to set up. It took me about a minute to get them turned on and synced with my lap top. Pressing the keys feels very responsive and comfortable. I love the short cut keys for the calc. The volume control and media controls are very convenient when playing music and skipping thru songs. The extended wrist support pad is a very nice comfort feature for people who use the keyboard for several hrs a day. Overall i am very happy with the keyboard and all of its cool features.
customer_reviews.author: N.Dub

customer_reviews.title: Great reliable combo
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my work from home setup during COVID 19. This is a great reliable combo Pros: Great Overall build It comes with several ergonomically oriented features and has two different settings for elevation feet in the back to accommodate the keyboard inclination to your needs. Many programmable buttons, helps to add quick shortcuts Easy to connect, works great Cons: No caps-lock or num-lock indicator led. Unusual orientation of insert, home, end, delete, and page up/down keys The ergonomics are also subjective to the size of your hands and being 6'1, I have larger hands so my experience may be different to most. Overall, this is a good product.
customer_reviews.author: Aditya Agrawal

customer_reviews.title: Says it is a quiet keyboard and it is not
customer_reviews.text: Main purpose of getting keyboard was for wireless feature and "quiet keys". Not quiet at all!
customer_reviews.author: Agarcia

customer_reviews.title: PRODUCT SUPPORT DOES NOT EXIST!!
customer_reviews.text: I have the M510 wireless mouse & K350 wireless keyboard. Paid extra for set to secure additional features. Pulled out of box & plugged in. Basic system worked just fine but no clues provided on how to set or use extra features. Went to logitech & downloaded extra user program. NO HELP! Tonight I just spent over an hour going around in circles, downloaded another "User Support". Waste of time. IMPOSSIBLE TO REACH A HUMAN, even to just send an email with a few questions. I am sure they have some info somewhere, but it is well hidden.Maybe a miracle will happen & someone from logitech will see this & offer to help. My lottery ticket will probably win first.
customer_reviews.author: 19d60

customer_reviews.title: Good keyboard, some wireless interference when using in office environments
customer_reviews.text: Pros: - wireless - great keyboard layout - embedded media center controls - nice key response Cons: - from time to time I have experienced delays in response (I assume due to issues communicating with the unified receiver) My setup: Win 10 Pro, 64-bit running on DELL XPS14. I am using the keyboard in an office environment
customer_reviews.author: Geongo

customer_reviews.title: No 'CapLock' message as with previous Keyboard---NOT INTUITIVE for user!
customer_reviews.text: All works find. However, a VERY IMPORTANT feature with a keyboard is to display a message that you have left the cap lock function on. This is especially true if you have multiple passwords, etc. for online use. I have unfortunately, gotten LOCKED OUT...by re-submitting what I though was my passwords on various accounts. I had to move cursor to visible area to check if the case sensitive password was being entered wrong! NOT COOL....
customer_reviews.author: DKH buyer

customer_reviews.title: I'm typing on it now.  Hooray.
customer_reviews.text: Its a keyboard. Pretty decently ergonomic design. The slight curvature of the keys takes a bit to get used to but I like it now. Keys have a long travel to them and are noisy with a solid feeling of engaging when pressed. Light typers used to a Mac keyboard, for instance, won't like this but I like it just fine. Mouse is fine, nothing special but I haven't had any issues with it either. I use this for gaming, work, and lots of typing. It works fine for all of those uses. I wouldn't consider it anything more than a casual gaming keyboard, though. It works way better than the last keyboard I spilled juice in, thats for sure.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas A.

customer_reviews.title: Wouldn't recommend
customer_reviews.text: I wouldn't recommend this keyboard. Unless you press each key "just right"....ie up and down, the keys bind and you end up with many corrections. For clarity, when I'm typing fast my fingers sometime push down and sideways (not excessively).....so many jams that I'm shelving this unit after 8 months and going back to a much less expensive and less ergonomic keyboard. I'd rather deal with the lack of ergonomics than the constant frustration of having to backspace and correct because the keys don't work right. I'm not a gamer, but I imagine that for gaming this keyboard would be quite frustrating as well.
customer_reviews.author: JustKidding

customer_reviews.title: Great Keyboard
customer_reviews.text: We purchased two K350s (one for each of us) Keyboards over 4 Years ago. Over the last few months, the keys on my keyboard have become somewhat nonresponsive and you quite often have press the keys repeatedly before they start working again However, our other K350 still working as good as the first day we got it. I’m constantly typing/using the keyboard so no surprise It’s finally wearing out. The keyboard layout has a lot to offer and its wavy design is more comfortable and has more features than any other boards I’ve had. Overall, I love the K350 and I’m considering buying a new. For the price I think it’s the best board on the market.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy L. Hubbell

customer_reviews.title: Nice keyboard, lots of features, keys feel light and rebound feels sloppy
customer_reviews.text: Have the Logitech Mouse and needed a keyboard that syncs on the same plug. Takes a bit to get used to the shape but after a bit it feel more natural. My only gripe is with the keys. My traditional Logitech keyboard had keys that had a soft feel when stricken. They feel thin and hallow and ten rebound is clunky. Might sound picky but when you spend 40+ hrs a week at the keyboard, having your keyboard and mouse be quality is vital for a pleasant experience.
customer_reviews.author: James J. Bender

customer_reviews.title: I love this keyboard!
customer_reviews.text: I cannot believe I have put up with the generic keyboards that came with the computer for so long! I am feeling pretty dumb right now. I accidentally turned off my computer with the power button. This controls everything and I didn't have to update or anything. Just plugged in the toggle and off it went. I will update if something bad happens, but so far I love this. My hands/fingers hit where they should. The hand rest is fabulous. I love having controls on the keyboard for videos since I watch a ton. I'll be figuring out the cool features for awhile it looks like. I love new toys! :0)
customer_reviews.author: Connie

customer_reviews.title: Logitech Wave Bundle...my go to!
customer_reviews.text: The Logitech Wave is my all time favorite keyboard and it remains my go to keyboard for work. After dealing with a couple of cheap keyboards at home (my husband's picks, not mine), I pulled rank and bought the Wave for home too. Both my husband and son love it as well. The Wave is ergonomic, has multiple convenience/short cut keys and provides overall comfort while typing. The keys are not tiny and super close together but are spaced out comfortably. The keyboard comes with a good quality and sized mouse that is also pleasant to use. While I feel like a complete office supply nerd in saying this, I really do love this bundle!
customer_reviews.author: Aim

customer_reviews.title: Good keyboard, but letters wear off too quickly
customer_reviews.text: I've owned a few of these. I have to replace them every two years or so. The letters wear off. It's not a problem when I am looking at the screen and typing, which is what I usually do. I've been able to type without looking down for a long, long time. But when I have to look at the keyboard to slowly enter letters/numbers (like with a code), then I'm looking down at a keyboard with several letters worn off. This is not the first time. I think I'll buy a different brand this time. Fool me once...but fool me three times???
customer_reviews.author: JM

customer_reviews.title: Very Poor Key Action
customer_reviews.text: Although I game and use a lot of mechanical keyboards, I also use a lot of traditional/cheaper keyboards, so my expectations for this thing are not those of a $250+ mechanical monstrosity. That said, the keys almost stick when pressed and are slow to come back up again. I can't remember any keyboard ever doing this. It's almost like there's a thick axle grease that slooooowwwws the keys down. There isn't, obviously, but it's the best analogy I can come up with. I pulled the batteries and threw the keyboard in storage for emergency use only.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Not impressed
customer_reviews.text: I got this keyboard in the mail yesterday. Tried it out right away and compared to my existing Logitech keyboard, this was lacks responsiveness. The mouse was horrible. Extremely slow at hovering over things. The keyboard also makes too much noise. Packed it right back up and requested to return it. I never really return things. But I just couldn’t deal with the disappointment. For the price, I was hoping for better quality.
customer_reviews.author: Mayra Gutierrez

customer_reviews.title: Cheap Squeaky Mouse and Keyboard?  What the Heck?
customer_reviews.text: I have an older Logitech Wave Keyboard I like - it's a little bulky and the buttons aren't great, but I love the ergonomics of it. However - the mouse. How did they mess this up? My 5 year old Logitech Mouse is fine, but this new one has a mouse wheel for scrolling that is noisy. Like audibly scratchy. It's stunning and annoying to the point that I'm returning it. Also, the space bar of the key board has a flimsy feel and squeaky noise to it. This is really stunning that a $50 keyboard/mouse set is so cheap feeling/sounding.
customer_reviews.author: Sureshoe

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable!
customer_reviews.text: I love the feel of the keyboard. There’s a slight learning curve for my fingers but I’m sure I’ll be used to it very shortly. The only thing I struggle with is the placement of the “end” key in relation to the delete key-I keep hitting page down. Again though I’m sure I’ll get used to this quickly.
customer_reviews.author: NFUP

customer_reviews.title: K350 Logitech Keyboard works once Logitech Unifying Software has been downloaded
customer_reviews.text: I bought the Logitech Wave Ergonomic Keyboard and Mouse combo MK 350 but the sales invoice states MK550. Anyway in order to make the keyboard work I had to go to Logitech's web site and down load Logitech Unifying Software as the wireless mouse was working but the keyboard was not. I am writing this to help someone else with this daunting problem.
customer_reviews.author: Telma D.

customer_reviews.title: Heaven on my hands
customer_reviews.text: Working from home due to Covid-19 was reeking havoc on my hands. I was spending hours a day using my laptop keyboard. I'm a teacher and I know I have over a month to go in the school year. I bought this keyboard and it has been such a relief. Literally. My hands and wrists feel so much better and are not all cramped together. I LOVE having the number pad to the right. It makes entering grades for students so easy. I like the other features too, like the power to the laptop and the volume controls. This was definitely a smart purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Baxter Malone

customer_reviews.title: Best Keyboard Ever!!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this keyboard after seeing one in my office and I fell in love. Since my job is entirely on the computer the slight wave of the keyboard helps position my self correctly so I can type comfortably. I have small chubby hands so I would fat finger the keyboard a lot especially when trying to reach for another letter. I also have long nails and due to the spacing inbetween the keys, they don't get in the way. My grammatical errors have gone down tremendously. As far as gaming goes it would be like using a typical keyboard but the mouse has multiple buttons on the side that are programmable.
customer_reviews.author: Alexis

customer_reviews.title: Where is my C key? Jilted on this product and the extra warranty
customer_reviews.text: For some strange reason the “C” key is fading. This is my second keyboard and this keeps happening. The keyboard itself is not bad, but the key letters fading is just weird. Now more letters are missing. Don't waste your money on this product. How do I paint new numbers onto the keyboard that won't fade? Oh and the stupid warranty they try and sell you just told me it won't cover the damage, so I am stuck with this piece of crap and will have to buy an actual wireless keyboard that holds up to use.
customer_reviews.author: Blondeecakes

customer_reviews.title: Great feel and touch
customer_reviews.text: Replaced an OEM keyboard and mouse with this set and I really am happy with it. Feels comfortable but isn't a wide spread ergonomic. Keys respond well to my natural typing touch so I can type quickly without having to correct myself along the way. Mouse is also very comfortable Very easy to set up both. My only nitpick details would be there's no indication if num lock or caps lock are on and the Home/Delete/End/Page up/page Down keys are oriented in a different way than every other keyboard so it takes some adjustment.
customer_reviews.author: Lori Miller

customer_reviews.title: Logitech Wave keyboard
customer_reviews.text: After receiving keyboard I gave it a good trial run and it was phenomenal!! The ergonomics' felt great with allowing you to have a better wrist position helped me with my carpal tunnel issues. The wrist pad feels a lot better than resting your hands on the desktop as you are typing. I would highly recommend this keyboard set to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Duncan Siler

customer_reviews.title: Had to buy another
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the first keyboard and mouse after working for home for a month. They worked great!! My wife started to work from home and she took my keyboard and mouse because she liked them so much. My first set have been working for about 3 months without an issue, new set working just as good. For $50 this is well worth the price, but beware..... You might have to purchase a couple like I did!!! Will update if I have one.
customer_reviews.author: Jed Jannsen

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable but loud
customer_reviews.text: This is a great keyboard in terms of comfort. However, it is very loud. I gently tap on the keys yet it sounds as if I had long acrylic nails pounding on the keys. It’s a little distracting to me let alone those around me. I use it in my home office so there’s not that big problem annoying coworkers, but even at home I have to close my door to minimize the sound. It is a little more difficult during calls where I am expected to type responses/make notes in documents while still participating in the call because I can’t constantly mute and unmute my call.
customer_reviews.author: Long Shot

customer_reviews.title: OK keyboard with some weird key layout
customer_reviews.text: Initially I thought this is a nice keyboard with the exception of how the Home/End/Delete/Page Up/Page Down keys are positioned. I've never used a keyboard that had this configuration and have really been having a hard time adjusting. The keyboard is also pretty loud and the spacebar has gone a little loose after just a few weeks of daily use. The springs seems to have lost some resistance so I keep inserting a space accidentally when my hand lightly touches the space key.
customer_reviews.author: Alina B.

customer_reviews.title: KEYBOARD IS GOOD BUT THE MOUSE ANNOYINGLY DOUBLE CLICKS ON ITS OWN
customer_reviews.text: (The one-star review is due to the mouse being so bad) I needed to replace my keyboard and mouse. I normally have no problem with Logitech products but this one is a first. The mouse in this set worked well for about 2 months then inexplicably when I do a single left click about 50% of the time the mouse double clicks on its own. It is really annoying because when you are trying to select an item or just highlight it the item opens up. Sometimes painful when web surfing or just checking my email. The mouse is very disappointing!
customer_reviews.author: R. M. W.

customer_reviews.title: Very oversized and not comfortable to use for office work.
customer_reviews.text: Keyboard was higher than expected. Didn't turn on. Maybe damaged in transit. Looked like it had been opened before. Put new batteries in but nothing. Overall, though I did not like the size and shape. If it had worked, I'd be returning it anyway. Took up a lot of room on my desk. Not easy to use for everyday office work.
customer_reviews.author: Mar

customer_reviews.title: Couldn't be any happier. Best choice, #1 for a reason.
customer_reviews.text: I couldn't be any happier with my new keyboard. It's the best choice and number one recommended for a reason. Love the desing, the feel, tha pad for that extra comfort and all these lil extra short cuts, pretty handy. I had doubts about performance and how steady it was based on some users reviews, but decided to try it myself and..., Walla. Best choice ever. It's pretty firm, stays locked in place, "it does not cave-in from the middle like some people said, I do not need extra support to hold it up, but then again it's up to everybodies needs and how you feel about it. Works for me, hope it does for you.
customer_reviews.author: Vicky Velázquez

customer_reviews.title: Letters Rub Off
customer_reviews.text: Almost 1 month to the day after I can return this, which would be almost 3 months from the date of purchase, I noticed that three of the letters are almost gone. I'm a pretty good, fast touch typist, and don't look at the keyboard very often, but I don't want to use an unmarked keyboard. So, I borrowed my Lenovo plug-in keyboard from work. It would be nice if there were some replacement stickers, so once I'm done with this working at home jazz I can go back to this one...
customer_reviews.author: dragonflyeye

customer_reviews.title: Don't last
customer_reviews.text: The first one of these I bought was great, lasted for over 2 years and I spend way too much time on computers. For guys with big hands, it's great. I bought a replacement beginning of the year and within 3 weeks I could not get the bluetooth connection to be constant. Had a free replacement sent to me and this time it died 6 weeks later. Past the deadline to return. I suspect it's the wireless receiver in my usb port as I have troubles with keyboard and mouse. Loved my first one but after being sent 2 lemons and out $50, no longer can recommend buying one.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: DESCRIPTION TOTAL LIE-BUYER BEWARE
customer_reviews.text: The description of this item claims it has no defects, is in like new condition, with no visible wear. WRONG! There are obvious scuffs and once we got it out we could tell it was refurbished. Description also says it should come with batteries included. NO BATTERIES INCLUDED AT ALL! We got screwed! This was for a present and now it isn't complete and it doesn't look brand new. Seller flat out lied. If you can, buy something else from someone else.
customer_reviews.author: M and K

customer_reviews.title: Some keys have stopped working.
customer_reviews.text: The keys are fully functional, i.e. no sticky drink spilled, they just don't do anything when you push them. And of course, I am a month past my return window. I cannot do the "at" symbol, I cannot use an opening bracket, I cannot close a parenthesis, and I cannot end a sentence with a question mark. Until I get a new keyboard, I have a page open in Word in which I have inserted all the symbols I cannot type. So I am here, just copy and pasting into my document. Talk about a time waste! I will not recommend this keyboard to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: PERFECT FOR MY WORK
customer_reviews.text: I love this keyboard already. I thought the ergo design might take some getting used to, but I loved it instantly. It's like a spa for my poor, tired wrists and hands. I do transcription work and type at least eight hours a day. This is going to save me so much pain in the long run. Also, the keys are the perfect size and height, making my typing more accurate and fast. I'm so incredibly glad that I broke down and ordered a new keyboard. Good quality everything, especially the lovely mouse.
customer_reviews.author: rayenrox

customer_reviews.title: Logitech disappoints, keys fading after 1 month of use!
customer_reviews.text: Pretty disappointed, this arrived 7/2/20 and I started using it 2 weeks later. I’ve used it for a month and the letters N and M are starting to fade off. I wouldn’t recommend using this keyboard if you type all the time for work. Also- I made sure I had no lotion or oils on my hands as I know that causes fading also.
customer_reviews.author: Amy S

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product.  Easy to set up.  Works better than the laptop keyboard.  Great value.
customer_reviews.text: I have never used a cordless mouse or keyboard so I feared the technology from the start. Now that I am required to work from home I was desperate for cordless tools. Keyboard and mouse immediately installed itself upon plugging in the USB transmitter. The amazing ergonomic keyboard has all the bell and whistles (volume control, calculator, music and video control among other buttons) while the mouse is very ergonomic and well design for most surfaces. No regrets in purchasing this product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great and Comfortable! Just one annoying thing...
customer_reviews.text: Great keyboard. Comfortable to use without having keys separated down the middle. Keys are easy and smooth to push. The one annoying thing that I figured out after I plugged it in is that THERE IS NO CAPS LOCK INDICATOR. You either have to remember if its on or not (and who would when constantly switching between screens and programs) or just type onto something to find out. It's most annoying when I have to sign-in to multiple programs or websites or write an email while working with my business accounting software (which I mostly use Caps for) and end up typing in the password 2 times before I figure out - oh yeah maybe the Caps Lock is on..
customer_reviews.author: P. Rose

customer_reviews.title: Ideal Keyboard for Heavy Use
customer_reviews.text: I just got mine, and I love it! I can't vouch for how well it wears over time, but I already just love this keyboard. Not only are the key rows curved to allow for natural positioning of the hands and wrists, the key height is varied to accommodate the variation in finger length. The key action is just right, at least in my opinion. There is some clatter, but the action itself is great. I haven't had it long enough to play with the programmable keys, but anticipate using them a lot in my work. The mouse works great, too. I'm one happy camper!
customer_reviews.author: HopSez

customer_reviews.title: Loved the one for work, bought another for home
customer_reviews.text: I owned one for work for years now and love the ergonomic features. Battery life is exceptional for both the keyboard and mouse, and easy to change when it's time. Bought a second set for my home office to make it easy using my laptop back and forth. I Used the Logitech Unifying app to pair both sets to the same USB receiver. I definitely recommend and have often to coworkers when they comment on the contour design. Note that I don't use many of the "special" keys to offer insight on their usability.
customer_reviews.author: Judy H

customer_reviews.title: PERFECT IN SUPPORT OF MY NEW LENOVO 330S
customer_reviews.text: I recently purchased a nicely made Lenovo 330S with one small annoying problem--the keyboard. Not sure why the company "shade" the keyboard and made too much room for a keypad that will get little use since I am a professional writer. The wireless Logitech MK550 is the perfect answer. The wave keyboard is ergonomically designed to provide comfort for extended typing periods. The accompanying mouse is simply the best ergonomic mouse I have used in the past 10 years. The connection to the laptop was instantaneous upon powering up. My workstation is now set. Perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Lorenzo York

customer_reviews.title: Great keyboard
customer_reviews.text: This is my third time buying the Logitech Wave keyboard. I use the computer and type a lot [historical researcher], so I need usability, comfort, and quality. I knew when it was time to buy another keyboard (I type so much I wear off the letters of the keyboard), I would buy this one again. Whenever I use someone else's keyboard, I wonder how in the world they can stand it. I love this keyboard, and have no problems with it.
customer_reviews.author: B. Bauser

customer_reviews.title: Bulky but Great
customer_reviews.text: Really enjoy the functionality of the keyboard with all of the added buttons. It takes some time to get used to, but that is by design. I feel that the ergonomics of the keyboard are excellent, and have taken a lot of pressure off of my wrists. A couple things to note; the keys can be pretty loud as they are raised more than most modern keyboards. Also, be prepared for typos since the ergonomics take some time to get used to. Overall, the functionality of the devices is great. This was a really great value for the mouse and keyboard combo.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best Ergonomic Keyboard Ever !
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this keyboard / mouse combo for my office. After using different brands and paying up to $100 for a different type; I found this keyboard to provide the perfect ergonomic relief I needed. The slant of the keyboard allows your fingers to rest naturally on the keyboard, making typing more intuitive without the excess strain on your wrists. The attached wrist pad is also a nice feature as it allows your hands to rest properly upon the keyboard. There are lots of bonus buttons on the keyboard as well for controlling music, volume, calculator, etc. Do yourself a favor. Purchase this keyboard and save yourself some money. You won't regret it!
customer_reviews.author: Xander Devereaux

customer_reviews.title: It's okay, not as good as Microsoft ergo split keyboard
customer_reviews.text: It wasn't bad, better than a standard keyboard. I've been using Microsoft's ergonomic keyboard for so long, I tried this for about a week and it was too small for my hands. I have average size men's hands, not tiny like Trump's or huge like Michael Jordan. It was like my fingers kept bumping into each other. I swapped it with my wife for my Microsoft board, she also feels like it's ok but not as good as the Microsoft ergo board.
customer_reviews.author: C. Dean

customer_reviews.title: Best Keyboard / Mouse combo ever!
customer_reviews.text: I have almost always got these keyboard / mouse combo. They provide good positioning to the wrists to allow you to be relaxed while typing, while the slight curve makes it easier on your fingers to press further away keys. The batteries last a very long time and the music controls make it really easy to adjust your volume or track really easily. The mouse is nice and comes with the back and forth side buttons and mouse wheel. What more could you want!
customer_reviews.author: Daocsm

customer_reviews.title: Logitech Unifying receiver popped out went between wall and washing machine!
customer_reviews.text: At first I could not find the Logitech Unifying receiver in the packaging. After 30 minutes of retracing all of my steps taking the box apart, I concluded that the missing part must have popped out without being seen; not on the floor in front of the washing machine on which I opened the box, so I removed the washing machine and found it between the wall and washing machine on the floor. This is not the first Logitech product with a hard to find receiver. So, as good as the keyboard may or may not be, it gets 1 star. I was totally frustrated by poor product packaging! Get with it!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product love the feel of the key board
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for our business and the letter D didn't work. I called amazon and in 1day i had new one shipped to me for free and a free postage label to return defective one. Im proud to be a part of Amazon and that they quickly fixed problem. We loved our one we had long ago so it was just a uh oh as i tell my grandson I love buying online with Amazon because they dont give you any problems when u have a problem. Besides our special franchise equipment we are an amazon 2400 sq ft building. So thats the only thing we have had problems with im impressed. And turn around was amazing.
customer_reviews.author: Sheri

customer_reviews.title: Good keyboard with a couple quirks
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for work about a year ago. The battery life is great and the contour is comfortable. The keys are a little blocky -- i'd prefer for them to be shorter and to require less pressure when typing. The keystrokes are pretttty loud. The battery life indicator light seems fairly useless, and the lack of a caps lock indicator light is annoying. In addition, the labels on some of the keys are starting to wear off. Overall, i'm glad i bought it but would prefer some features to be better thought out.
customer_reviews.author: kathleen

customer_reviews.title: Great for carpal tunnel syndrome
customer_reviews.text: I suffered from wrist and lower arm pain for years until I switched to this keyboard and mouse combo. I love them. And the wireless feature means no annoying cords. My only reason for giving 4 stars instead of 5 is that this is my third set because the letters on the keys wear off after about a year of heavy use. Wish I could just buy replacement keys.
customer_reviews.author: Shoppin' Mom

customer_reviews.title: Keyboard is a K350, not K550 as posted on Amazon
customer_reviews.text: Bought it to replace a 6-year old K350 which had sticking keys. New unit is identical, but the setup instructions fail to tell you that after syncing, you must restart your computer to get the keyboard and mouse working. Wasted an hour on Google and Logitech website troubleshooting the problem before I found the answer. Come on, Logitech, how could you miss something this simple in your instructions?
customer_reviews.author: Jack B, aka Bigwoof

customer_reviews.title: The absolute loudest keyboard I have ever used.
customer_reviews.text: It's huge, but that's OK. It's comfortable, but the keys feel crowded. And now the entire neighborhood knows that I'm typing or gaming. The clack of these keys can probably be heard a mile away from my house. I will be sending this back. Usually, it's my family who gets annoyed at the sound of my typing, but now I can barely stand it. My ears will be bleeding by the time I'm done with the work day.
customer_reviews.author: E.E.B.G.

customer_reviews.title: Nice keyboard our hands would thank
customer_reviews.text: I was always trying to go for a cheap wireless keyboard mouse combo priced $20-30. Realized if I can spend $50-$65 would end up getting a wireless wave keyboard and mice. So far this keyboard has been working great. The wave format, the hand rest greatly reduces the strain on hands which was the primary reason I bought this set. Being a left hand person the mouse is not very comfortable as it is configured for a right hand person. Getting used to the mouse.
customer_reviews.author: Tiru

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable layout, but those keys!!
customer_reviews.text: The design and layout of the keyboard and mouse are actually very comfortable. The extra buttons for convenience are a nice touch. However, the only negative is that the keys are tall and slightly loose on the board like older keyboards. Because of that looseness, they make that loud "clickety-clack" sound when typing. If the keys were shorter and had a tight fit in their respective slots like modern keyboards, I would rate it a 5.
customer_reviews.author: Riv2359

customer_reviews.title: Recommend buying one from Walmart or Target
customer_reviews.text: Ordered the keyboard in April it is now July and some of the keys don’t work. Unable to return because “window” closed. Really upsetting you spend a decent amount of money and unable to get your money worth. If I could I would give this zero stars I had a better chance at buying one from Walmart.
customer_reviews.author: Summer

customer_reviews.title: Great Keyboard/Mouse Combo
customer_reviews.text: I was surprised to see that it came with a USB extension in order to get better connectivity. I use this combo for my office on two computers so it's as simple as moving the USB connector from the USB extension to my laptop when needed. I say this because it would probably be more of a pain without the usb extension. The material of the keyboard is nice. Palms rest nicely as I'm typing this to you. Keys...press...nicely? lol I can say, I've dropped the mouse several times and it didn't splatter. Very smooth running around my screen. Great purchase, enjoy!
customer_reviews.author: Thatsthegoodstuff

customer_reviews.title: Letters worn off.
customer_reviews.text: This is my first ergonomic keyboard and the shape is really great. It's much more comfortable than a traditional keyboard. However, I hate that the wrist wrest is not removable as it makes my wrist and hands sweat and I don't like it at all. Another problem is the lettering on the keys. I've only had the keyboard for a month and several letters have already worn off. I've had other products from this brand before and was very happy so I'm very disappointed in this keyboard. It certainly works, but I don't foresee it lasting for very long.
customer_reviews.author: Becky

customer_reviews.title: I hate to say this about a Logitech, but junk.
customer_reviews.text: I needed a new keyboard and previously had a logitech that I loved. Unfortunately, this keyboard did not live up to even the cheapo $10 ones I used to sport. This keyboard has connectivity issues constantly, and if anything gets between it and the USB receiver, even my arm, it likes to lose connectivity. It also has severe lag at times when typing. Both it, and the mouse, also eat batteries. I would not recommend this product to anyone that does any sort of work on their computer, unless they work for a battery manufacturer. Actually, I would only ever recommend Logitech's higher end lines, instead of their cheapo combos like this.
customer_reviews.author: EvieM

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable keyboard.
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this keyboard for some time now, and I really like it. The key distance is great, so it's easy to type. The curve and angle of the keyboard sections is just enough to make it comfortable. The touch of the keys is very nice. I also like the extra control buttons. I no longer have to reach behind my monitor to adjust the volume on my speakers plus other handy features. This is a great keyboard at a very good price.
customer_reviews.author: Circuitrider

customer_reviews.title: I loved it but....
customer_reviews.text: I love the feel, and the clicking clack...but the letters are beginning to wear away and I've only been using it 7 weeks for work. For $50, the letters shouldn't be wearing out. I've had $10 keyboards that did that after a year. UPDATE: week 8, now there's a major delay in my typing. Nothing will appear, then a few letters. Seems to happen when I first begin to type. It stinks because I really liked this keyboard but it doesn't seem to work properly.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: You can trust Logitech
customer_reviews.text: This is the second combo keyboard and mouse I have purchased. Last one was an MK 350, so this is a newer version. We just got a new laptop, so I figured time to get a new keyboard too. I have always had good luck with Logitech products. Good feel to keys, good ergonomics, plug and play, no pairing needed. One important thing, I find that the UNIFYING RECEIVER should be plugged into one of the USB ports on your computer for best connection.
customer_reviews.author: John A. Theotonio

customer_reviews.title: Sticky keys out of the box
customer_reviews.text: this keyboard is really good ergonomically, i even use it for light gaming. however.... this was the first keyboard i have purchased, that came with multiple sticky keys (Del, Print Screen, F7,F8, F9 etc.) if it weren't for the sticky keys it would be 5 stars... the reason why I'm giving it 1 star is for this reason. Brand new keyboards, sealed in the box should come as brand new (no sticky keys or anything). this product however, feels like i paid premium price for a used item. Thanks Logitech!
customer_reviews.author: KM

customer_reviews.title: Mouse stopped working properly within 4 months - Keyboard is fine
customer_reviews.text: Less than four months after ordering this item, the mouse has become sluggish (even after changing batteries) and does not respond well: when you move the mouse, the cursor does not move in sync with the mouse, making it very challenging to bring the cursor where you need it to be in a reliable and quick fashion. The keyboard continues to work fine however. The mouse worked great the first two months but things have gone progressively downhill after that... If you buy this for the keyboard, go ahead - if you buy it for the mouse or both, look elsewhere! I hope this helps.
customer_reviews.author: Frenchman in Boston

customer_reviews.title: It's the Little Things
customer_reviews.text: This wireless keyboard and mouse combo is a great value. It has greatly improved my comfort while working from home while also helping to avoid the clutter of having wires running all over the desk at my home office. The battery life has been impressive so far (no doubt due to the excellent sleep mode feature), and I can heartily recommend this to anyone looking to upgrade their workstation.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Morris

customer_reviews.title: Love this combo keyboard/mouse
customer_reviews.text: Glad I opted to do a little research and find this combo pack. The keyboard is ergo without being "over the top ergo" and hard for me to get used to. I had a standard keyboard in the office and have been using a tiny 13" laptop for the last two months so this is a huge upgrade. The mouse is also very well made. Feels good in your hand and you can tell that Logitech products are high-end.
customer_reviews.author: John Belanger

customer_reviews.title: This is the second keyboard just like this that I've had
customer_reviews.text: This is the second keyboard just like this that I've had. I like the shape of it because it's very comfortable for my hands. I don't know why I thought this one would be better than the first, but once again, within 3 months the most used letters have worn off. This brand is the only keyboard that has ever done this. I am a very fast typist, and I don't often need to see the keys, but others who used my keyboard were always complaining, which is really what led me to get another. This is ridiculous. Logitech is supposed to make a quality product. This is the last Logitech product I will buy.
customer_reviews.author: Carol Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Get rid of the number pad.
customer_reviews.text: I like the actual key board and have quickly adjusted to using it. However, if I center the keyboard so my elbows are at my sides, the number pad extends out to the right and there is no place for my mouse. I have to place is so far off to the side or in front of the keyboard which is causing my shoulder pain. My inconvenient work around is to stop and actually move the key board back when I am using the mouse alot and switch it back when I am typing. So sad about this because otherwise I like it.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: Totally with it!
customer_reviews.text: LOVE this keyboard!!! In our business I’m always on the computer, so this really helps. After two years of use, I’ve worn off a few letters, but I’m sure I’m still in the same set of batteries I put in originally. Somewhat of an adjustment coming from a normal keyboard to this, but now I’m it sure I could ever go back! This is a great wireless keyboard and worth every dime.
customer_reviews.author: D Morrison

customer_reviews.title: ... mouse is on the heavier side but it works perfect. The range seems to work perfectly
customer_reviews.text: The mouse is on the heavier side but it works perfect. The range seems to work perfectly. I do love the fact that even though my mouse is always on, the battery life lasts longer than other mouse (amazon basic mouse). The keyboard feels nice, however, my key gets stuck pretty often. My letter a, e, left & right arrow key feels like they get stuck as i would have to press down extra hard for the button to go down. I do like the spread of the keyboard as it does feel right. 5 Star for range 5 Star for battery life/usage 3 star for weight of mouse 1 star for keyboard press strength 4 star for keyboard spacing.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Holding on lap more erogonomic
customer_reviews.text: I got this after my chiropractor told me that arms should be bent at 90 degrees when using a keyboard. I did not want to replace an expensive desk, so this was my solution. Much better for sure! My upper and lower back are much better! Sometimes there is a lag time between when I start typing and it shows up. Not sure why that is--maybe I go too fast. It only happens when I start typing and not always. My computer is not new so I'm wondering if it's the computer speed rather than the keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: Cinnamom

customer_reviews.title: Keyboard loses connectivity very often.
customer_reviews.text: For a couple months after purchase, the keyboard worked OK. Since that time, it just does not work most of the time (and should, for the money paid). It loses connectivity constantly - sometimes in the middle of typing a sentence. If the computer sits for a while without activity, it usually requires me to remove and replace the USB plug to restart communication. It actually lost connection twice typing this short review. This scenario is repeated EVERY DAY. I have replaced the batteries, I have moved the USB to another location, to no avail. Note: the mouse works great. I sincerely wish I could still return this for a refund. I would not recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: azgirl65

customer_reviews.title: Got it, but some buttons didn't work
customer_reviews.text: Got this combo only to have to return it as a couple buttons decided that they didn't need to work (R, right parenthesis). I have another one that I use at work and haven't had any issues (thus the three star) but this one didn't work out of the box. The return policy is easy which also helped this keep to a 3 star. Since I really needed one that worked I tried a Microsoft branded version and it works out of the box so that is an improvement.
customer_reviews.author: Tylor Husske

customer_reviews.title: Died prior to 2-years
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable to use. Purchased in August 2017, RIP June 2019. Quality is disappointing, see the photo, key identifiers started disappearing after one year, more so on the left side of the board. "D" is completely gone, passed into the great Alphabet in the sky, A,E, and C not quite dead yet and can be heard pondering what awaits their afterlife.
customer_reviews.author: Ole Miss Rebel 8811

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Keyboard - especially for those who type all day.
customer_reviews.text: I love this new keyboard. It looks great, and It's very sturdy and has a solid feel. It doesn't feel like a hollow plastic keyboard and make loud noise as you type. I love the slightly curved angle as I have had surgery due to keyboarding for my job. It has helped remove pressure from my nerves. I can't tell you anything about gaming aspect as I am not a gamer, but it is extremely nice.
customer_reviews.author: S. Albright

customer_reviews.title: MK550 is NOT a K350!  BUYER BEWARE
customer_reviews.text: As a technologist, I have been using this keyboard for years. Great function and form with both keyboard and mouse operating off a single small USB. When it was time to purchase a new keyboard for work, I immediately went to this keyboard. Because I have a K350 I noted that a MK550 (still wave) was available....I immediately hit "Buy it now.". Upon arrival, I noticed that the keyboard was a K350, thinking it was a mistake, I sent it back to Amazon and asked for a new purchase. To my displeasure, the new one was also a K350. I don't appreciate being tricked by this misinformation. Buyer be warned.....
customer_reviews.author: Daniel P. Lizun

customer_reviews.title: Impressed with quality!
customer_reviews.text: Not the same "feel" as the old style corded Microsoft Ergonomic Keyboards (long unavailable). But probably as good as it gets for the "modern" wireless keyboards for typists. My only complaint is that keys seems to space slightly closer and the key elevations are slightly different from the older Microsoft Ergonomic models so I seem to make more mistakes than I used to but for the price I am very pleased- especially when compared to the newer Microsoft models. The key response is quite good, not too noisy and time/use may adjust for my old habits...
customer_reviews.author: Sj Construction

customer_reviews.title: Best Keyboard and Mouse Ever
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't sure about getting this keyboard as I haven't used an ergonomic one like this before. I am so use to the normal "flat" ones out there. Once I got this I was amazed by how well it fits the way I type. The mouse is the BEST too. The whole package is worth every penny and more.
customer_reviews.author: B. McCarthy

customer_reviews.title: Sticky Text
customer_reviews.text: Its nice for ergonomics most of the buttons don't work like short cuts i think this was designed with windows 7 in mind because it has a media center button which I believe ended with windows 7. Its not responsive like all the time im trying to type and it has to catch up, i read this happening to someone else but thought maybe it would be the same with me , because I really need a new keyboard and mouse. I want money back im returning this and just going to buy something more expensive and hope that works
customer_reviews.author: traumega

customer_reviews.title: Check everything out and make sure that you received what you paid for.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased and paid for model MK550 and the box stated that it was a MK550 however, while setting up the bottom of the keyboard was clearly labelled that the model was MK350. I did not try hooking it up as I did not know if the small receiving unit in the box was the proper unit for the keyboard and mouse which are both laser units.
customer_reviews.author: John Panos

customer_reviews.title: Works right off the bat
customer_reviews.text: This worked in a windows 7 machine and windows 2000. Nice variety of extra buttons that are highly customizable with added software from logitech (which I didn't bother to install on win2k obv.) I wish the keys had more of a click though. They just have a soft push down to the stop and not a real tactile click that I like. All the F keys at the top have a nice click.
customer_reviews.author: David K.

customer_reviews.title: It's the little things
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard and mouse are an exact match to the items we replaced. How much different, and how wonderful, the new ones feel. Our old mouse was half blind and moved at the pace of a snail. Our old keyboard had a few keys that stuck, some letters worn off, and looked it's age -- about ten years old. I am now of the opinion that because they are quite affordable these days, replacing these tools more often would not be amiss.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Really like it!
customer_reviews.text: I really like this keyboard and mouse! I was concerned about how long it would take to adjust to the shape of the keyboard and larger mouse, but it was really easy to adjust to and I find them very comfortable. The one concern was that a couple of the letters started to wear off, but there are ways to deal with that. I put clear nail polish over them, which seems to have helped. Or I hear there are keyboard letter stickers that can be purchased. Overall, I’m really happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: K

customer_reviews.title: Great keyboard! Great mouse!
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard has a padded area for resting your palms and that is something I vastly prefer over the standard flat keyboards. I've owned and tried many different mouse products over the years and none match the great feel this one has. My right hand/fingers fit around the mouse perfectly. I have slightly larger than average hands and these preferences might not apply to everyone. A USB cable is included. One end plugs into a USB port on your computer and in the other end you can plug a small Bluetooth receiver that picks up both keyboard and mouse inputs.
customer_reviews.author: Koos

customer_reviews.title: Good enugh, but the mouse has a mind of its own
customer_reviews.text: The keys are easy to use--a bit noisy and "springy" to the touch, and it takes up a bit of space, but otherwise, it seems fine. What I find really annoying is the mouse, which has a tendency to scroll up automatically without any control---it's very weird. I went into Settings to see if this feature could be controlled, and there is no setting for it.
customer_reviews.author: HistoryBuff

customer_reviews.title: NOT ergonomic
customer_reviews.text: I think the description and keywords for this keyboard are deceptive. It has over 10K reviews, high rates AND a description as "ergonomic," but I'm returning it. Anyone who really needs an ergonomic design for pain or comfort reasons should beware.
customer_reviews.author: Labella

customer_reviews.title: Works Fine; Feels Cheesy
customer_reviews.text: I ignored the old maxim "you get what you pay for" when I bought this-shame on me because I spend many hours on a keyboard doing professional work, and I shouldn't have tried to be cheap. Previous logitech products were fine, but this clearly was made to minimize manufacturing costs. The keys rattle around in the board, and the mouse wheel wobbles like it was mounted on a toothpick. Everything works fine, and it would be great for a 6th grader, but now, sadly, I will bid Logitech farewell, bite the bullet, and buy something that ideally has the feel of a 1958 IBM Selectric--and I understand such things are now on the market, albeit not inexpensive.
customer_reviews.author: Frankie

customer_reviews.title: If you miss the sound of a mid century typewriter this keyboard is for you
customer_reviews.text: This wretched thing can be heard blocks away. My wife purchased this at the start of the Covid 19 outbreak and listening to her type on this damn thing is enough to drive a person to drink. It sounds like a constant jackhammer as if your sharing an office with a construction worker. This keyboard is for single people who live in very remote locations (Think Ted Kaczynski) Schools for the deaf Anyone who hears voices and is trying to drown them out. This keyboard isn’t for: Everyone that isn’t listed above
customer_reviews.author: Alex J Heyen

customer_reviews.title: It took two!
customer_reviews.text: The first one I got was clearly defective, typing some times and then stopping. Amazon replaced it quickly and I'm a happy camper now. The keyboard is nice to type on and has a lot of setting to make your hands safer. I love the ergonomics of the keyboard and the mouse
customer_reviews.author: Lee E.

customer_reviews.title: So far, not bad.
customer_reviews.text: The mouse feel is quite nice. A much better upgrade from the previous one I was using. The keyboard keys seem quite "deep". I'm not very happy about that, coming from flat keyboards that have short strokes, much like a laptop. This will take some getting used to. The hand placement is very nice and comfortable. For the money, I'm happy with the purchase so far but at this point it is right out of the box. I saw questions regarding the noise level of the keys. It is about average to loud. I've used louder keyboards but also have used much quieter ones.
customer_reviews.author: Antonius

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable Keyboard
customer_reviews.text: I have long been a fan of the Logitech ergonomic keyboards. The wave is very comfortable for my hands to use over extended periods of time. The keys have the right combination of easy to push and responsiveness so your hand does not tire out or get sore from too-hard keys. The function keys make work all that much easier and efficient. This is a great keyboard addition for my home office.
customer_reviews.author: A. Silverstone

customer_reviews.title: Logitech is the most comfortable keyboard I have ever found
customer_reviews.text: It has a soft bar at the end of it where you can rest your palms, this helps relieve stress on your hands. The curve fits your hands better, and it even has a find it placement so even the blind could use this keyboard. I like the soft cushion, not found on many others. But I've use this particular keyboard for many years and as a write I can tell you, it helps end corporal tunnel problems with the hands. I replace mine about every three to five years as I wear them out typing so much. But I always get Logitech.
customer_reviews.author: Redameter

customer_reviews.title: Buy something else, this is junky
customer_reviews.text: IT Professional, own my own consulting company since 2002. Bought because I like ergonomic and they are difficult to find. It’s extremely noisy and cheap to the touch. Very disappointed, as I have always loved Logitech keyboards and mice. Will be replacing soon as the clickety-clack sound gives me a headache, as I use this all day long. Will have to buy non-ergonomic to replace I guess. Bummer!
customer_reviews.author: Jodi Paulsen

customer_reviews.title: LOVE this set, will re-purchase forever
customer_reviews.text: I had this keyboard/mouse set for 3-4 years at my office until the letters and numbers rubbed off the keys. My office replaced it with a standard straight keyboard and mouse with no frills and I realized how great THIS model was. I immediately went online and purchased this one again, as my hands were so used to the keyboard shape and options, and even the mouse size and shape. It’s big, so if you’re looking for a compact keyboard this isn’t it. Despite knowing we aren’t supposed to rest our palms while typing, if you sometimes do, this has a great pad to keep your hands comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Chilexi

product_meta.title: Logitech MK550 Wireless Wave Keyboard and Mouse Combo - Includes Keyboard and Mouse, Long Battery Life, Ergonomic Wave Design - Black
product_meta.description:
Style:M510 mouse

The Logitech MK550 Wireless Wave Keyboard and Mouse uses an ergonomic wave design for more natural typing when working. The Logitech Constant Curve layout is similar to regular keyboards but eases the stress on your wrists and allows for more comfortable working. There are also 18 programmable keys that allow for rapid navigation to applications you use frequently.

The integrated palm rest and adjustable keyboard height help reduce wrist fatigue and make it easier to type for longer periods of time without strain.

Say goodbye to your micro mouse or touch pad. The MK550 includes a precision laser mouse for faster navigation and detailed work.

The Logitech MK550 Wireless Wave Keyboard and Mouse Combo will have you working for longer with ease. The keyboard has a 3 year battery life, and the mouse has a 2 year battery life.

 Setup is simple—just plug in the Logitech Unifying receiver and you’re ready to go. Your keystrokes are safe with built in 128 bit AES grade encryption. Keystroke dropouts and keyboard lag are a thing of the past with the built in 2.4GHz wireless signal.

System requirements : Windows XP, Windows Vista, Windows 7, Windows 8, Windows 10,USB port, Internet connection (for software download) system requirements: Windows XP Windows Vista Windows 7 Windows 8 Windows 10|USB port|Internet connection (for software download).
feature_bullets: Ergonomic wave design: The MK550 uses Logitech’s Constant Curve layout for reduced stress and better, more natural typing
Integrated palm rest: Experience lower wrist fatigue with the integrated palm rest, three options for leg height allow you to adjust the keyboard to the height that feels most comfortable to you
Precision laser mouse: Say goodbye to your touchpad with the included MK510 precision laser mouse; the mouse and keyboard are so energy efficient
Long battery life: Use your keyboard and mouse for longer with the MK550’s extended battery life. The K350 keyboard has a battery life of upto 3 years and the mouse, upto 2 years
Simple setup: There’s no additional setup involved when using the MK550 in Windows based PC - Windows XP, Windows Vista, Windows 7, Windows 8 and Windows 10

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars12,715 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
